results.title: Portrait of a girl
results.brief_description: An experimental film. Uses close up photography and low key lighting to provide an unusual and perhaps cruel look at a familiar and everyday occurrence; the ritual of a girl applying her makeup. We see a series of rather frightening extreme close-ups, and not until the second last shot do we see the girl’s face completely; a shot which is held only long enough to give a tantalising glimpse of her.

results.title: Portrait of a gallery
results.creator_credit: Art Gallery of New South Wales, Film Australia, Malcolm Otton, Roan Hannam and John Sexton
results.brief_description: An explanation of the aims of the Art Gallery of New South Wales followed by a short tour of the gallery. The film covers the history of the gallery from about 1871 to the present day. Shows its present building - the old wings and the new modern gallery section and gives an idea of its major collections, its many activities both public and behind the scenes, and its hopes and plans for the future.

results.title: Portrait in painting
results.brief_description: This program traces the development of portraiture from Ancient Egypt until the present. Artists such as Reynolds, Gainsborough, Goya and Fragonard are treated as well as the Impressionists and Post Impressionists.

results.title: Portland: Victoria's first settlement
results.brief_description: Traces the history of the development in the Portland region since the early nineteeth century when some two hundred sealers were working Bass Strait. Todays Portland’s deep harbour is used by ships from more than fifty countries as well as deep sea trawlers that land tonnes of fish. Portland’s latest primary industry looks to be an aluminium smelter being built at a cost of eleven hundred million dollars.

results.title: Portland beef carcase competition 1960
results.brief_description: Promotional film highlighting the quality of Victorian beef. Shots of people looking at meat, etc throughout. Includes disturbing footage of beef carcases being hung. Great ‘The End’ title. See Also: 1955 Pig Carcase Competition at Dandenong and 1957 Pig Carcase Competition at Dandenong.

results.title: Portland
results.creator_credit: Eric Porter Productions, Eric Porter and John Porter
results.brief_description: This is a short account of the history and industry of Portland, a coastal town southwest Victoria. Portland was settled in the 1830s by the Henty Brothers who utilised its location for fishing, shipping and storage. However, its industry has grown to cover timber, beef and wool which are often exported. Also covers Portland’s annual festivities and the attractions it holds for visitors.

results.title: Porter's magic dreams
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Sam Grana and James Rottboll
results.brief_description: Brian Porter, surrealist, paints his dreams. The film is an incursion into his very private life, which consists of painting, and waiting to paint. Beautifully shot, with a sound track that shifts from the strident sounds of a synthesizer to the warmer cadences of a guitar, the film moves unhurriedly through changing moods and ethereal visions.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Sam Grana and James Rottboll

results.title: Portable TVs (Retro Vision)
results.brief_description: Australians loved portable TVs. How else could you watch cricket at the beach or take your favourite show camping? Despite how portable these units were, due to using batteries, their small stature saw them positioned in the home just as much as the great outdoors, and they gradually became more of a fashion statement during the late 1970s and 80s. The most fashionable of the ones displayed here is easily the JVC Videosphere, which came in red, black, white and orange, and was designed to look like a space helmet, in homage to 2001: A Space Odyssey and the popularity of the Space Race in 1970 when it was released. It’s since appeared as props in Hollywood films and in video artist Nam June Paik’s installation, TV Buddha (1974).

The most fashionable of the ones displayed here is easily the JVC Videosphere, which came in red, black, white and orange, and was designed to look like a space helmet, in homage to 2001: A Space Odyssey and the popularity of the Space Race in 1970 when it was released. results.brief_description: Shows a variety of pneumatic tools in service in road construction, building destruction and various civil engineering projects. Stresses the need for reliable, portable tools in a wide range of jobs.

results.title: Portable fire extinguishers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safetycare”.
Looks at firefighting techniques of starvation, smothering, cooling and stopping the chemical chain reaction; extinguishing agents such as water, foam, carbon dioxide and dry powder; fire extinguishers for ordinary combustibles, flammable and combustible liquids, flammable gases, combustible metals, electrically energised equipment and cooking oils & fats; classifications of fires and the operation of fire extinguishers. The main aim of this package is to provide the facilitator with discussion points important to the overall development of the program and to allow participants the opportunity of discussing the impact the program may have on current work practices and whether in fact changes may be required. Included is a Trainer’s Manual.
